author: Rich Brown
title: Calgary spoils the Canucks' home opener
text:
Summary Jared McCann scored his first NHL goal in the loss
Canucks fall to the Flames in overtime
VANCOUVER (NEWS 1130) – Bo Horvat and Jared McCann scored second period goals for Vancouver, but Johnny Gaudreau tallied in overtime for Calgary as the Flames beat the Canucks 3-2 at Rogers Arena.
The Flames got redemption for Wednesday’s game which saw Vancouver spoil their home opener with a 5-1 victory.
Calgary opened the scoring five minutes into the first period on the powerplay. Defenseman Dougie Hamilton wired home a wrist-shot for his first goal as a member of the Flames.
Vancouver took the lead with a pair of goals in the second period. Horvat tallied his first career powerplay goal at the 2:03 mark as he got his own rebound and fired it home past Jonas Hiller. Shortly past the midway mark, McCann took a feed from Jannik Hansen and put a perfect wrister past Hiller for his first NHL goal.
The Flames held the edge in play in the third period and with 11:11 to play, they were rewarded. Sean Monahan beat Ryan Miller with a quick shot to make it a 2-2 game.
Vancouver started its first three-on-three overtime game with Henrik Sedin, Daniel Sedin and Matt Bartkowski on the ice. Early in the extra session Henrik set up Daniel at the side of the goal, but Hiller made a sprawling pad save to keep the game going. That save allowed Gaudreau to force a turnover and beat Miller short-side for the game-winner.
Miller made 35 saves in the loss, while Hiller turned aside 28 shots.
The Canucks will head out on the road to take on the Anaheim Ducks on Monday.
